arm_group.description: IMRT combine with cisplatin concurrent chemotherapy plus capecitabine adjuvant chemotherapy
IMRT combine with cisplatin concurrent chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock:
This is an  randomized, controlled, multicenter phase II clinical trial. The purpose of this
      study is to evaluate acute toxicity and efficacy of concurrent cisplatin chemoradiation with
      or without capecitabine as adjuvant chemotherapy in local advanced high risk nasopharyngeal
      carcinoma.

clinical_study.brief_title: Concurrent Cisplatin Chemoradiation With or Without Capecitabine as Adjuvant Chemotherapy in Local Advanced High Risk Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma: Phase II Randomized Control Clinical Trial
clinical_study.condition: Local Advanced High Risk Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Newly histologic diagnosis of nasopharyngeal carcinoma(WHO II/III)

          -  Clinical stage III~IVb(UICC 7th)

          -  Meet at least one factor below :1 primary tumor SUVmax>10 in 18F-FDG PET/CT;2 primary
             tumor volume＞30cm3;3 mutiple metastatic cervical lymph node with at least one's short
             diameter＞4cm; 4 T4N2M0; 5 T1-4N3M0;6 EBV-DNA＞2×10E4 copy/l

          -  Range from 18～70 years old

          -  WBC count ≥ 4×109/L，Hemoglobin ≥ 100g/L， platelet count ≥ 100×109/L

          -  ALT or AST ＜ 2.5×ULN、bilirubin ＜ 1.5×ULN

          -  OSerum creatinine ＜ 1.5×ULN

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Central nervous system metastases

          -  Suitable for local treatment

          -  Uncontrolled seizure disorder or other serious neurologic disease

          -  Clinically significant cardiac or respiratory disease

          -  Drug or alcohol addition

          -  Do not have full capacity for civil acts

          -  Severe complication, active infection

          -  Concurrent immunotherapy or hormone therapy for other diseases

          -  Pregnancy or lactation

intervention.description: Patients in the control arm received radical radiotherapy with IMRT, and cisplatin (100mg/m2 on day 1) every three weeks for three cycles during RT.
intervention.intervention_name: IMRT combine with cisplatin concurrent chemotherapy

intervention.description: Patients in the experimental arm received radical radiotherapy with IMRT, and cisplatin (100mg/m2 on day 1) every three weeks for three cycles during RT,followed by adjuvant chemotherapy with oral capecitabine(1000mg/m2/ twice a day for 14 days)every three weeks for eight cycles.
intervention.intervention_name: IMRT combine with cisplatin concurrent chemotherapy plus capecitabine adjuvant chemotherapy

link.description: Home Page of Cancer Center, Sun Yat-sen University

clinical_study.official_title: Concurrent Cisplatin Chemoradiation With or Without Capecitabine as Adjuvant Chemotherapy in Local Advanced High Risk Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma: Phase II Randomized Control Clinical Trial

other_outcome.measure: Three-year locoregional relapse free survival rate
Three-year distance metastasis free survival rate

other_outcome.description: To evaluate the late toxicity with the RTOG/EORTC criterion when concurrent cisplatin chemoradiation with or without capecitabine as adjuvant chemotherapy is used.

primary_outcome.description: Defined as the time in months from first dose of cisplatin until PD is observed or death occurs due to any cause.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the acute toxicity with CTC 3.0 when concurrent cisplatin chemoradiation with or without capecitabine as adjuvant chemotherapy is used.

collaborator.agency: Guangzhou General Hospital of Guangzhou Military Command

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
